answers.answer: Hi there!Well aside the age limit, different countries have different criteria of prerequisites required to serve in the military. While most countries would allow a well managed diabetic to serve in non-combat roles a few may not even allow this; though medically there is no contraindication to serve on non-combat roles.Hope this information is helpful.Take care!

question: Hello, all...I've read the comments about people with type 1 diabetes who wish to serve in the military. I am a type 2 diabetic that just turned 43 years old, and had seriously considered returning to the service, but was unsure whether or not (at the time I was considering joining the Army) if I would be automatically disqualified. Last I checked, I am too old now, but the curiosity still remains.
title: Adult Type II Diabetes and Military Service
